cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: openssh security update

full_product_name.product_name: openssh-0:8.0p1-10.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)
openssh-0:8.0p1-10.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux BaseOS (v. 8)

notes.note: openssh: Observable discrepancy leading to an information leak in the algorithm negotiation

reference.description: bz#1852930: CVE-2020-14145 openssh: Observable discrepancy leading to an information leak in the algorithm negotiation

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
After installing this update, the OpenSSH server daemon (sshd) will be restarted automatically.

note:
An update for openssh is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

OpenSSH is an SSH protocol implementation supported by a number of Linux, UNIX, and similar operating systems. It includes the core files necessary for both the OpenSSH client and server.
Security Fix(es):
* openssh: Observable discrepancy leading to an information leak in the algorithm negotiation (CVE-2020-14145)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.
